trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Prerequisites and hardware | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Prerequisites and hardware | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Article description that will be displayed on landing pages and in most search results
trans-unit.target: Article description that will be displayed on landing pages and in most search results

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites for Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites for Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the pre-requisites and the hardware requirements for Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the pre-requisites and the hardware requirements for Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Before you install Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Before you install Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Before you install Azure AD Connect, there are a few things that you will need.
trans-unit.target: Before you install Azure AD Connect, there are a few things that you will need.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Azure AD

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription or an [Azure trial subscription](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription or an [Azure trial subscription](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: This is only required for accessing the Azure portal and not for using Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: This is only required for accessing the Azure portal and not for using Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: If you are using PowerShell or Office 365 you do not need an Azure subscription to use Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: If you are using PowerShell or Office 365 you do not need an Azure subscription to use Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: If you have an Office 365 license you can also use the Office 365 portal.
trans-unit.target: If you have an Office 365 license you can also use the Office 365 portal.

trans-unit.source: With a paid Office 365 license you can also get into the Azure portal from the Office 365 portal.
trans-unit.target: With a paid Office 365 license you can also get into the Azure portal from the Office 365 portal.

trans-unit.source: [Add and verify the domain](active-directory-add-domain.md) you plan to use in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [Add and verify the domain](active-directory-add-domain.md) you plan to use in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: For example if you plan to use contoso.com for your users then make sure this domain has been verified and you are not only using the contoso.onmicrosoft.com default domain.
trans-unit.target: For example if you plan to use contoso.com for your users then make sure this domain has been verified and you are not only using the contoso.onmicrosoft.com default domain.

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD directory will by default allow 50k objects.
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD directory will by default allow 50k objects.

trans-unit.source: When you verify the domain the limit will be increased to 300k objects.
trans-unit.target: When you verify the domain the limit will be increased to 300k objects.

trans-unit.source: If you need even more objects in Azure AD you need to open a support case to have the limit increased even further.
trans-unit.target: If you need even more objects in Azure AD you need to open a support case to have the limit increased even further.

trans-unit.source: If you need more than 500k objects, you will need a license such as Office 365, Azure AD Basic, Azure AD Premium, or Enterprise Mobility Suite.
trans-unit.target: If you need more than 500k objects, you will need a license such as Office 365, Azure AD Basic, Azure AD Premium, or Enterprise Mobility Suite.

trans-unit.source: On-premises servers and environment
trans-unit.target: On-premises servers and environment

trans-unit.source: The AD schema version and forest functional level must be Windows Server 2003 or later.
trans-unit.target: The AD schema version and forest functional level must be Windows Server 2003 or later.

trans-unit.source: The domain controllers can run any version as long as the schema and forest level requirements are met.
trans-unit.target: The domain controllers can run any version as long as the schema and forest level requirements are met.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to use the feature **password writeback** the Domain Controllers must be on Windows Server 2008 (with latest SP) or later.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to use the feature **password writeback** the Domain Controllers must be on Windows Server 2008 (with latest SP) or later.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect cannot be installed on Small Business Server or Windows Server Essentials.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect cannot be installed on Small Business Server or Windows Server Essentials.

trans-unit.source: The server must be using Windows Server standard or better.
trans-unit.target: The server must be using Windows Server standard or better.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect must be installed on Windows Server 2008 or later.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect must be installed on Windows Server 2008 or later.

trans-unit.source: This server may be a domain controller or a member server if using express settings.
trans-unit.target: This server may be a domain controller or a member server if using express settings.

trans-unit.source: If you use custom settings, the server can also be stand-alone and does not have to be joined to a domain.
trans-unit.target: If you use custom settings, the server can also be stand-alone and does not have to be joined to a domain.

trans-unit.source: If you install Azure AD Connect on Windows Server 2008, make sure to apply the latest hotfixes from Windows Update.
trans-unit.target: If you install Azure AD Connect on Windows Server 2008, make sure to apply the latest hotfixes from Windows Update.

trans-unit.source: The installation will not be able to start with an unpatched server.
trans-unit.target: The installation will not be able to start with an unpatched server.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to use the feature **password synchronization**, the Azure AD Connect server must be on Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 or later.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to use the feature **password synchronization**, the Azure AD Connect server must be on Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 or later.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Connect server must have [.Net 4.5.1](#component-prerequisites) or later and [PowerShell 3.0](#component-prerequisites) or later installed.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Connect server must have [.Net 4.5.1](#component-prerequisites) or later and [PowerShell 3.0](#component-prerequisites) or later installed.

trans-unit.source: If Active Directory Federation Services is being deployed, the servers where AD FS or Web Application Proxy will be installed must be Windows Server 2012 R2 or later.
trans-unit.target: If Active Directory Federation Services is being deployed, the servers where AD FS or Web Application Proxy will be installed must be Windows Server 2012 R2 or later.

trans-unit.source: [Windows remote management](#windows-remote-management) must be enabled on these servers for remote installation.
trans-unit.target: [Windows remote management](#windows-remote-management) must be enabled on these servers for remote installation.

trans-unit.source: If Active Directory Federation Services is being deployed, you need [SSL Certificates](#ssl-certificate-requirements).
trans-unit.target: If Active Directory Federation Services is being deployed, you need [SSL Certificates](#ssl-certificate-requirements).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect requires a SQL Server database to store identity data.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect requires a SQL Server database to store identity data.

trans-unit.source: By default a SQL Server 2012 Express LocalDB (a light version of SQL Server Express) is installed and the service account for the service is created on the local machine.
trans-unit.target: By default a SQL Server 2012 Express LocalDB (a light version of SQL Server Express) is installed and the service account for the service is created on the local machine.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Express has a 10GB size limit that enables you to manage approximately 100.000 objects.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Express has a 10GB size limit that enables you to manage approximately 100.000 objects.

trans-unit.source: If you need to manage a higher volume of directory objects, you need to point the installation process to a different version of SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: If you need to manage a higher volume of directory objects, you need to point the installation process to a different version of SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect supports all flavors of Microsoft SQL Server from SQL Server 2008 (with SP4) to SQL Server 2014.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect supports all flavors of Microsoft SQL Server from SQL Server 2008 (with SP4) to SQL Server 2014.

trans-unit.source: Accounts
trans-unit.target: Accounts

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD Global Administrator account for the Azure AD directory you wish to integrate with.
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD Global Administrator account for the Azure AD directory you wish to integrate with.

trans-unit.source: An Enterprise Administrator account for your local Active Directory if you use express settings or upgrade from DirSync.
trans-unit.target: An Enterprise Administrator account for your local Active Directory if you use express settings or upgrade from DirSync.

trans-unit.source: [Accounts is Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md) if you use the custom settings installation path.
trans-unit.target: [Accounts is Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md) if you use the custom settings installation path.

trans-unit.source: Connectivity
trans-unit.target: Connectivity

trans-unit.source: If you are using an outbound proxy for connecting to the Internet, the following setting in the **C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\Config\machine.config** file must be added for the installation wizard and Azure AD sync to be able to connect to the Internet and Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an outbound proxy for connecting to the Internet, the following setting in the **C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\Config\machine.config** file must be added for the installation wizard and Azure AD sync to be able to connect to the Internet and Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: This text must be entered at the bottom of the file.
trans-unit.target: This text must be entered at the bottom of the file.

trans-unit.source: In this code, <PROXYADRESS> represents the actual proxy IP address or host name.
trans-unit.target: In this code, <PROXYADRESS> represents the actual proxy IP address or host name.

trans-unit.source: If your proxy server requires authentication, then the section should look like this instead.
trans-unit.target: If your proxy server requires authentication, then the section should look like this instead.

trans-unit.source: With this change in machine.config the installation wizard and sync engine will respond to authentication requests from the proxy server.
trans-unit.target: With this change in machine.config the installation wizard and sync engine will respond to authentication requests from the proxy server.

trans-unit.source: In all installation wizard pages, excluding the **Configure** page, the signed in user's credentials are used.
trans-unit.target: In all installation wizard pages, excluding the **Configure** page, the signed in user's credentials are used.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure** page at the end of the installation wizard, the context is switched to the [service account](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md#azure-ad-connect-sync-service-accounts) which was created.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure** page at the end of the installation wizard, the context is switched to the [service account](active-directory-aadconnect-accounts-permissions.md#azure-ad-connect-sync-service-accounts) which was created.

trans-unit.source: See MSDN for more information about the [default proxy Element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/kd3cf2ex.aspx).
trans-unit.target: See MSDN for more information about the [default proxy Element](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/kd3cf2ex.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If your proxy limits which URLs which can be accessed then the URLs documented in [Office 365 URLs and IP address ranges ](https://support.office.com/article/Office-365-URLs-and-IP-address-ranges-8548a211-3fe7-47cb-abb1-355ea5aa88a2) must be opened in the proxy.
trans-unit.target: If your proxy limits which URLs which can be accessed then the URLs documented in [Office 365 URLs and IP address ranges ](https://support.office.com/article/Office-365-URLs-and-IP-address-ranges-8548a211-3fe7-47cb-abb1-355ea5aa88a2) must be opened in the proxy.

trans-unit.source: Other
trans-unit.target: Other

trans-unit.source: Optional: A test user account to verify synchronization.
trans-unit.target: Optional: A test user account to verify synchronization.

trans-unit.source: Component prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Component prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect depends on PowerShell and .Net 4.5.1.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect depends on PowerShell and .Net 4.5.1.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your Windows Server version, do the following:
trans-unit.target: Depending on your Windows Server version, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012R2

trans-unit.source: PowerShell is installed by default, no action is required.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell is installed by default, no action is required.

trans-unit.source: .Net 4.5.1 and later releases are offered through Windows Update.
trans-unit.target: .Net 4.5.1 and later releases are offered through Windows Update.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have installed the latest updates to Windows Server in the Control Panel.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have installed the latest updates to Windows Server in the Control Panel.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2008R2 and Windows Server 2012
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2008R2 and Windows Server 2012

trans-unit.source: The latest version of PowerShell is available in **Windows Management Framework 4.0**, available on [Microsoft Download Center](http://www.microsoft.com/downloads).
trans-unit.target: The latest version of PowerShell is available in **Windows Management Framework 4.0**, available on [Microsoft Download Center](http://www.microsoft.com/downloads).

trans-unit.source: .Net 4.5.1 and later releases are available on [Microsoft Download Center](http://www.microsoft.com/downloads).
trans-unit.target: .Net 4.5.1 and later releases are available on [Microsoft Download Center](http://www.microsoft.com/downloads).

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2008
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2008

trans-unit.source: The latest supported version of PowerShell is available in **Windows Management Framework 3.0**, available on [Microsoft Download Center](http://www.microsoft.com/downloads).
trans-unit.target: The latest supported version of PowerShell is available in **Windows Management Framework 3.0**, available on [Microsoft Download Center](http://www.microsoft.com/downloads).

trans-unit.source: .Net 4.5.1 and later releases are available on [Microsoft Download Center](http://www.microsoft.com/downloads).
trans-unit.target: .Net 4.5.1 and later releases are available on [Microsoft Download Center](http://www.microsoft.com/downloads).

trans-unit.source: Windows Remote Management
trans-unit.target: Windows Remote Management

trans-unit.source: When using Azure AD Connect to deploy Active Directory Federation Services or the Web Application Proxy, check the requirements below to ensure connectivity and configuration will succeed:
trans-unit.target: When using Azure AD Connect to deploy Active Directory Federation Services or the Web Application Proxy, check the requirements below to ensure connectivity and configuration will succeed:

trans-unit.source: If the target server is domain joined, ensure that Windows Remote Managed is enabled
trans-unit.target: If the target server is domain joined, ensure that Windows Remote Managed is enabled

trans-unit.source: In an elevated PSH command window, use command `Enable-PSRemoting –force`
trans-unit.target: In an elevated PSH command window, use command `Enable-PSRemoting –force`

trans-unit.source: If the target server is a non-domain joined WAP machine, there are a couple of additional requirements
trans-unit.target: If the target server is a non-domain joined WAP machine, there are a couple of additional requirements

trans-unit.source: On the target machine (WAP machine):
trans-unit.target: On the target machine (WAP machine):

trans-unit.source: Ensure the winrm (Windows Remote Management / WS-Management) service is running via the Services snap-in
trans-unit.target: Ensure the winrm (Windows Remote Management / WS-Management) service is running via the Services snap-in

trans-unit.source: In an elevated PSH command window, use command `Enable-PSRemoting –force`
trans-unit.target: In an elevated PSH command window, use command `Enable-PSRemoting –force`

trans-unit.source: On the machine on which the wizard is running (if the target machine is non-domain joined or untrusted domain):
trans-unit.target: On the machine on which the wizard is running (if the target machine is non-domain joined or untrusted domain):

trans-unit.source: In an elevated PSH command window, use the command `Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts –Value <DMZServerFQDN> -Force –Concatenate`
trans-unit.target: In an elevated PSH command window, use the command `Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts –Value <DMZServerFQDN> -Force –Concatenate`

trans-unit.source: In Server Manager:
trans-unit.target: In Server Manager:

trans-unit.source: add DMZ WAP host to machine pool (server manager -> Manage -> Add Servers...use DNS tab)
trans-unit.target: add DMZ WAP host to machine pool (server manager -> Manage -> Add Servers...use DNS tab)

trans-unit.source: Server Manager All Servers tab: right click WAP server and choose Manage As..., enter local (not domain) creds for the WAP machine
trans-unit.target: Server Manager All Servers tab: right click WAP server and choose Manage As..., enter local (not domain) creds for the WAP machine

trans-unit.source: To validate remote PSH connectivity, in the Server Manager All Servers tab: right click WAP server and choose Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: To validate remote PSH connectivity, in the Server Manager All Servers tab: right click WAP server and choose Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: A remote PSH session should open to ensure remote PowerShell sessions can be established.
trans-unit.target: A remote PSH session should open to ensure remote PowerShell sessions can be established.

trans-unit.source: SSL Certificate Requirements
trans-unit.target: SSL Certificate Requirements

trans-unit.source: **Important:** it’s strongly recommended to use the same SSL certificate across all nodes of your AD FS farm as well as all Web Application proxy servers.
trans-unit.target: **Important:** it’s strongly recommended to use the same SSL certificate across all nodes of your AD FS farm as well as all Web Application proxy servers.

trans-unit.source: The certificate must be an X509 certificate.
trans-unit.target: The certificate must be an X509 certificate.

trans-unit.source: You can use a self-signed certificate on federation servers in a test lab environment.
trans-unit.target: You can use a self-signed certificate on federation servers in a test lab environment.

trans-unit.source: However, for a production environment, we recommend that you obtain the certificate from a public CA.
trans-unit.target: However, for a production environment, we recommend that you obtain the certificate from a public CA.

trans-unit.source: If using a certificate that is not publicly trusted, ensure that the certificate installed on each Web Application Proxy server is trusted on both the local server and on all federation servers
trans-unit.target: If using a certificate that is not publicly trusted, ensure that the certificate installed on each Web Application Proxy server is trusted on both the local server and on all federation servers

trans-unit.source: The identity of the certificate must match the federation service name (for example, fs.contoso.com).
trans-unit.target: The identity of the certificate must match the federation service name (for example, fs.contoso.com).

trans-unit.source: The identity is either a subject alternative name (SAN) extension of type dNSName or, if there are no SAN entries, the subject name specified as a common name.
trans-unit.target: The identity is either a subject alternative name (SAN) extension of type dNSName or, if there are no SAN entries, the subject name specified as a common name.

trans-unit.source: Multiple SAN entries can be present in the certificate, provided one of them matches the federation service name.
trans-unit.target: Multiple SAN entries can be present in the certificate, provided one of them matches the federation service name.

trans-unit.source: If you are planning to use Workplace Join, an additional SAN is required with the value **enterpriseregistration.**
trans-unit.target: If you are planning to use Workplace Join, an additional SAN is required with the value **enterpriseregistration.**

trans-unit.source: followed by the User Principal Name (UPN) suffix of your organization, for example, **enterpriseregistration.contoso.com**.
trans-unit.target: followed by the User Principal Name (UPN) suffix of your organization, for example, **enterpriseregistration.contoso.com**.

trans-unit.source: Certificates based on CryptoAPI next generation (CNG) keys and key storage providers are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Certificates based on CryptoAPI next generation (CNG) keys and key storage providers are not supported.

trans-unit.source: This means you must use a certificate based on a CSP (cryptographic service provider) and not a KSP (key storage provider).
trans-unit.target: This means you must use a certificate based on a CSP (cryptographic service provider) and not a KSP (key storage provider).

trans-unit.source: Wild card certificates are supported.
trans-unit.target: Wild card certificates are supported.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect supporting components
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect supporting components

trans-unit.source: The following is a list of components that Azure AD Connect will install on the server where Azure AD Connect is installed.
trans-unit.target: The following is a list of components that Azure AD Connect will install on the server where Azure AD Connect is installed.

trans-unit.source: This list is for a basic Express installation.
trans-unit.target: This list is for a basic Express installation.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to use a different SQL Server on the Install synchronization services page then SQL Express LocalDB is not installed locally.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to use a different SQL Server on the Install synchronization services page then SQL Express LocalDB is not installed locally.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Command Line Utilities
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Command Line Utilities

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Native Client
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Native Client

trans-unit.source: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Express LocalDB
trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Express LocalDB

trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.target: Microsoft Online Services Sign-In Assistant for IT Professionals

trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual C++ 2013 Redistribution Package

trans-unit.target: The minimum requirements for computers running AD FS or Web Application Servers is the following:
